intro: Tragacantha uspallatensis, commonly known as the Usalatensis tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clustered inflorescences. Its fruit is a legume that contains several seeds, and it is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
